Split.definition: to divide into parts or portions
Split.origin: [the Supreme Court splitting five to four, sustained the law "R. H. Bork"]

splitÂ·ting.definition: to divide into parts or portions

sub_terms.a: to divide into factions, parties, or groups
sub_terms.b: to mark (a ballot) or cast or register (a vote) so as to vote for candidates of different parties
sub_terms.c: to divide (stock) by issuing a larger number of shares to existing shareholders usually without increase in total par value see also
sub_terms.d: to divide (a cause of action) into separate parts or claims for the purpose of instituting an action for less than allto become divided or separated [the Supreme Courtfive to four, sustained the law "R. H. Bork"]adj

splitÂ·ting.note: Splitting a cause of action is usually prohibited.
splitÂ·ting.splitting: five to four, sustained the law "R. H. Bork"]

1.definition: divided into portions, parts, or fragments [a trial] [a stock]

2.definition: divided by or in opinion [a court] [a decision]
